column4: i dont think thats going to help; he wants to get the rest of his 2tb hdd
df indicates its mounting properly so the question is, why cant he access it all
120mb isnt worth a sneeze these days
dude... thats not his main concern right now
if you have a netbook with 4Gb then it is, or installed to an SD card etc
but those scenarios dont apply here
true, but it can be a significant lump of data
notice how I'm addressing both issues....
its gnome3, the next version. The shell has changed from gnome-panel to Unity
gnome is the DE, Compiz is the WM
omgubuntu has a how to for making the current Gnome look like Gnome2, if you want an easier way just use xfce
install xfce4 and log off, then log into xfce
look in power options and screen saver options. Its all there
just because you can't find something doesn't mean its not there
next question, how can I make the [MASSIVE ICONS] in unity smaller?
